department.dept_long_name: Department of Romance Languages and Literatures

course.title: Making Italians: Poetry and Novel in the 19th Century
course.description: The course discusses the two masterpieces of modern Italian literature, Giacomo Leopardi's Canti (Poems) and Alessandro Manzoni's I promessi sposi (The Betrothed), against the background of Risorgimento, the unification of Italy, and the affirmation of modernity.
course.notes: Conducted in English with sections in English and Italian (students can choose among the two sections).
